tasks.title: Main Landing Gear Upper Side Strut Removal

general.1: This procedure supplies instructions to remove the upper side strut.

references.title: Lift the Airplane with the Jacks (P/B 201)
Hydraulic System A or B Power Removal (P/B 201)
Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation (P/B 201)
Main Gear Downlock Springs Removal (P/B 401)

tools_equipment.description: Assembly - Wrench Adapter (C32029-3, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Driver - Slug (C32029-11, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Protector - Thread (C32029-12, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Protector - Thread (C32029-13, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)

zones.area: Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Left
Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Right

subtasks.content: If the downlock pins are not installed on all the landing gear, do this task: Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation, TASK 32-00-01-480-801.

warnings.content: MAKE SURE THE DOWNLOCK PINS ARE INSTALLED ON ALL THE LANDING GEAR, BUT THE ONE TO BE WORKED ON. WITHOUT THE DOWNLOCK PINS, THE LANDING GEAR COULD RETRACT AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

subtasks.content: Do this task: Lift the Airplane with the Jacks, TASK 07-11-01-580-815.
For hydraulic system A, do this task: Hydraulic System A or B Power Removal, TASK 29-11-00-860-805.
Do this task: Main Gear Downlock Springs Removal, TASK 32-32-91-000-801.
Disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the downlock strut [1]

instructions.content: Remove the pin [6] from the downlock link pin [2]
Remove the nut [5], and the washer [4] from the downlock link pin [2]
Remove the downlock link pin [2] to disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the downlock strut [1]

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1369, for the downlock link pin [2] when you do this step.

subtasks.content: Disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the lower side strut assembly, lower [8]]

instructions.content: Remove the cotter pin [13], nut [14], and washer [12] from the bolt [11]
Remove the bolt [11] from the side strut pin [7]
Use a rope to support the upper end of the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] and attach the rope to the outboard side of the reaction link assembly [15].

notes.content: The lower side strut weighs approximately 48.3 lb (21.91 kg).

instructions.content: Remove the end cap [9] from the side strut pin [7]
Remove the side strut pin [7] to disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the lower side strut assembly, lower [8]

notes.content: Use the slug driver, SPL-1367, for the side strut pin [7] when you do this step.

subtasks.content: Disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the reaction link assembly [15]

instructions.content: Remove the pin [19], nut [18], and washer [17] from cross bolt [16]
Remove the cross bolt [16] from the side strut pin [22]
Remove the side strut nut [20], and the side strut washer [21] from the side strut pin [22]

notes.content: Use wrench adapter wrench adapter assembly, SPL-1359, to hold the head of the side strut pin [22] when you loosen the side strut nut [20].

instructions.content: Remove the side strut pin [22] that holds the upper side strut assembly [3] to the reaction link assembly [15]

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1368, for the side strut pin [22] when you do this step.

subtasks.content: Lower the upper side strut assembly [3] carefully and remove it from the airplane

notes.content: Make sure the upper side strut is supported carefully when you lower it. The upper side strut weighs approximately 42.8 lb (19.41 kg).

tasks.title: Main Landing Gear Upper Side Strut Installation

general.1: This procedure supplies instructions to install the upper side strut

references.title: Lower the Airplane Off the Jacks (P/B 201)
Main Landing Gear Upper End Components Servicing (P/B 301)
Hydraulic System A or B Pressurization (P/B 201)
Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation (P/B 201)
Main Landing Gear Operational Test (P/B 501)
Main Landing Gear Test - Component Replacement (P/B 501)
Main Gear Downlock Spring Installation (P/B 401)

tools_equipment.description: Assembly - Wrench Adapter (C32029-3, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Protector - Thread (C32029-12, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Protector - Thread (C32029-13, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)

zones.area: Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Left
Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Right

subtasks.content: If the downlock pins are not installed on all the landing gear, do this task: Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation, TASK 32-00-01-480-801

warnings.content: MAKE SURE THE DOWNLOCK PINS ARE INSTALLED ON ALL THE LANDING GEAR, BUT THE ONE TO BE WORKED ON. WITHOUT THE DOWNLOCK PINS, THE LANDING GEAR COULD RETRACT AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

subtasks.content: Connect the upper side strut assembly [3] to the reaction link assembly [15]

instructions.content: Lubricate the chrome plated surfaces of the side strut pin [22] with grease, D00633
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633
Put the upper side strut assembly [3] in its position for connection to the reaction link assembly [15]
Put the side strut pin [22] through the upper side strut assembly [3] and the reaction link assembly [15]

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1368, for the side strut pin [22] when you do this step.

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE CORBAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

cautions.content: DO NOT APPLY CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND ON GREASE JOINTS, OR SEALED BEARINGS. THESE COMPOUNDS REMOVE GREASE AND OTHER LUBRICANTS. THEY ARE PENETRATING COMPOUNDS. THEY WILL MOVE AROUND THE SEALS AND INTO THE BEARINGS. THIS WILL CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE BEARINGS, AND JOINTS.

instructions.content:
Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 (preferred) or corrosion inhibiting material, G50136 (alternate) to these items:
1) The threads and thread reliefs of the side strut pin [22], and the cross bolt [16].
2) The threads of the side strut nut [20], and the nut [18].
3) The faces of the side strut washer [21], and the washer [17].

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

instructions.content: Remove all unwanted corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237
Install the side strut washer [21], and the side strut nut [20] on the side strut pin [22]
Tighten the side strut nut [20] to 600 in-lb (67.79 N*m) – 900 in-lb (101.69 N*m)

notes.content: Use the wrench adapter wrench adapter assembly, SPL-1359, to hold the head of the side strut pin [22] when you tighten the side strut nut [20].

instructions.content: If it is necessary, loosen the side strut nut [20] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the cross bolt [16]
Install the cross bolt [16] in the side strut pin [22]
Install the washer [17], and the nut [18] on the cross bolt [16]
Tighten the nut [18] to 30 in-lb (3.39 N*m) – 50 in-lb (5.65 N*m)
If it is necessary, loosen the nut [18] to the nearest castellation to align the holes for the pin [19].
Install the pin [19] in the cross bolt [16]

subtasks.content:
Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 (preferred) or corrosion inhibiting material, G50136 (alternate) to these items:
(a) The inside diameter of the side strut pin [7] and the inside unplated surface of the end caps [9].
(b) The threads of the nut [14].
(c) The face of the washer [12].

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

subtasks.content: Remove all unwanted corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237

instructions.content: Make sure the drainage holes in the end cap [9] are clear of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 after the application.

subtasks.content: Lubricate the chrome plated surfaces of the side strut pin [7] and the surfaces of the end cap [9] with grease, D00633.
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633.
Connect the upper side strut assembly [3] to the strut assembly, lower [8]

instructions.content: Remove the rope that supports the strut assembly, lower [8] to the reaction link assembly [15]
Put the upper side strut assembly [3] in its position for connection to the strut assembly, lower [8]
Put the side strut pin [7] through the upper side strut assembly [3] and the strut assembly, lower [8]
Install the end cap [9] on the side strut pin [7]

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE CORBAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

instructions.content: Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 (preferred) or corrosion inhibiting material, G50136 (alternate), to the threads, thread reliefs of the bolt [11], and its shank.

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

cautions.content: MAKE SURE THAT THE HEAD OF THE BOLT POINTS IN THE AFT DIRECTION. IF THE HEAD OF THE BOLT POINTS FORWARD, DAMAGE TO COMPONENTS AND THE AIRPLANE STRUCTURE WILL OCCUR.

instructions.content: Install the bolt [11] in the side strut pin [7]
Install the washer [12], and the nut [14] on the bolt [11]
Tighten the nut [14] to 30 in-lb (3.39 N*m) – 50 in-lb (5.65 N*m) more than the run on torque.
If it is necessary, loosen the nut [14] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the cotter pin [13].
Install the cotter pin [13] in the bolt [11]

subtasks.content: Connect the upper side strut assembly [3] to the downlock strut [1]

instructions.content: Lubricate the chrome plated surfaces of the downlock link pin [2] with grease, D00633
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633
Put the downlock strut [1] in its position for connection to the upper side strut assembly [3]
Put the downlock link pin [2] through the upper side strut assembly [3] and the downlock strut [1]

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1369, for the downlock link pin [2] when you do this step

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE COR-BAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

cautions.content: DO NOT APPLY CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND ON GREASE JOINTS, OR SEALED BEARINGS. THESE COMPOUNDS REMOVE GREASE AND OTHER LUBRICANTS. THEY ARE PENETRATING COMPOUNDS. THEY WILL MOVE AROUND THE SEALS AND INTO THE BEARINGS. THIS WILL CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE BEARINGS, AND JOINTS.

instructions.content:
Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 (preferred) or corrosion inhibiting material, G50136 (alternate) to these items:
1) The threads and thread reliefs of the downlock link pin [2].
2) The threads of the nut [5].
3) The faces of thewasher [4].

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

instructions.content: Remove all unwanted corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237
Install the washer [4], and the nut [5] on the downlock link pin [2]
Tighten the nut [5] to 360 in-lb (40.67 N*m) – 600 in-lb (67.79 N*m)
If it is necessary, loosen the nut [5] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the pin [6]
Install the pin [6] in the downlock link pin [2]

subtasks.content: Do this task: Main Gear Downlock Spring Installation, TASK 32-32-91-400-801.
Lubricate the lube fittings on the upper side strut. To lubricate them, refer to Main Landing Gear Upper End Components Servicing, TASK 12-21-11-640-801.
For hydraulic system A, do this task: Hydraulic System A or B Pressurization, TASK 29-11-00-860-801.
Do this task: Main Landing Gear Operational Test, TASK 32-32-00-710-801.

notes.content: It is optional to perform the Main Landing Gear Test - Component Replacement, TASK 32-32-00-710-802 instead of the operational test if a hydraulic cart is not available.

subtasks.content: Do this task: Lower the Airplane Off the Jacks, TASK 07-11-01-580-816.

tasks.title: Main Landing Gear Lower Side Strut Removal

general.1: This procedure supplies instructions to remove the lower side strut.

references.title: Lift the Airplane with the Jacks (P/B 201)
Hydraulic System A or B Power Removal (P/B 201)
Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation (P/B 201)
Main Gear Downlock Springs Removal (P/B 401)

tools_equipment.description: Protector - Thread (C32029-14, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)

zones.area: Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Left
Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Right

subtasks.content: If the downlock pins are not installed on all the landing gear, do this task: Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation, TASK 32-00-01-480-801

warnings.content: MAKE SURE THE DOWNLOCK PINS ARE INSTALLED ON ALL THE LANDING GEAR BUT THE ONE TO BE REMOVED. WITHOUT THE DOWNLOCK PINS, THE LANDING GEAR COULD RETRACT AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

subtasks.content: Do this task: Lift the Airplane with the Jacks, TASK 07-11-01-580-815.
For hydraulic system A, do this task: Hydraulic System A or B Power Removal, TASK 29-11-00-860-805.
Do this task: Main Gear Downlock Springs Removal, TASK 32-32-91-000-801.
Disconnect the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] from the pushrod [41]

instructions.content: Remove the nut [42], washer [43] from the bolt [46]
Remove the bolt [46] to disconnect the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] from the pushrod [41]
Remove the washer [45], bushing [45] from the pushrod [41]
Isolate the pushrod [41] from the lower side strut assembly, lower [8]

subtasks.content: Use a rope to hold the pushrod [41] and the inner door in its position
Disconnect the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] from the shock strut [51]

instructions.content: Remove the pin [49], nut [50], and washer [48] from the cross bolt [47]
Remove the cross bolt [47] from the side strut pin [52]
Remove the side strut nut [54], and the side strut washer [53] from the side strut pin [52]
Remove the side strut pin [52] to disconnect the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] from the shock strut [51]

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1370, for the side strut pin [52] when you do this step

subtasks.content: Disconnect the lower strut assembly, lower [8] from the upper side strut assembly [3]

instructions.content: Remove the cotter pin [13], nut [14], and washer [12] from the bolt [11]
Remove the bolt [11] from the side strut pin [7]
Remove the end cap [9] from the side strut pin [7]
Use a rope to support the upper end of the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] and attach the rope to the outboard side of the reaction link assembly [15]

notes.content: The lower side strut weighs approximately 48.3 lb (21.91 kg)

instructions.content: Remove the side strut pin [7] to disconnect the upper side strut assembly [3] from the lower side strut assembly, lower [8]

subtasks.content: Carefully lower and remove the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] from the airplane

notes.content: The lower side strut assembly, lower [8] weighs approximately 48.3 lb (21.91 kg). Make sure its sufficiently supported

tasks.title: Main Landing Gear Lower Side Strut Installation

general.1: This procedure supplies instructions to install the lower side strut.

references.title: Lower the Airplane Off the Jacks (P/B 201)
Main Landing Gear Upper End Components Servicing (P/B 301)
Hydraulic System A or B Pressurization (P/B 201)
Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation (P/B 201)
Main Landing Gear Shock Strut Door Adjustment (P/B 501)
Main Landing Gear Operational Test (P/B 501)
Main Landing Gear Test - Component Replacement (P/B 501)
Main Gear Downlock Spring Installation (P/B 401)

tools_equipment.description: Assembly - Wrench Adapter (C32029-39, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)
Protector - Thread (C32029-14, Part of Kit C32029-38 or C32029-45)

zones.area: Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Left
Main Landing Gear Wheel Well, Body Station 663.75 to Body Station 727.00 - Right

subtasks.content: If the downlock pins are not installed on all the landing gear, do this task: Landing Gear Downlock Pins Installation, TASK 32-00-01-480-801.

warnings.content: MAKE SURE THE DOWNLOCK PINS ARE INSTALLED ON ALL THE LANDING GEAR, BUT THE ONE TO BE REMOVED. WITHOUT THE DOWNLOCK PINS, THE LANDING GEAR COULD RETRACT AND CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONS AND DAMAGE TO EQUIPMENT.

subtasks.content:
Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 to these items:
(a) The inside diameter of the side strut pin [7] and the inside unplated surface of the end caps [9].
(b) The threads of the nut [14].
(c) The face of the washer [12].

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE COR-BAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

cautions.content: DO NOT APPLY CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND ON GREASE JOINTS, OR SEALED BEARINGS. THESE COMPOUNDS REMOVE GREASE AND OTHER LUBRICANTS. THEY ARE PENETRATING COMPOUNDS. THEY WILL MOVE AROUND THE SEALS AND INTO THE BEARINGS. THIS WILL CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE BEARINGS, AND JOINTS.

subtasks.content: Remove all unwanted corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237.

instructions.content: Make sure the drainage holes in the end cap [9] are clear of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 after the application.

subtasks.content: Lubricate the chrome plated surfaces of the side strut pin [7] and the surfaces of the end cap [9] with grease, D00633.
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633.
Connect the upper side strut assembly [3] to the strut assembly, lower [8]:

instructions.content: Remove the rope that supports the strut assembly, lower [8] to the reaction link assembly [15].
Put the upper side strut assembly [3] in its position for connection to the strut assembly, lower [8].
Put the side strut pin [7] through the upper side strut assembly [3] and the strut assembly, lower [8].
Install the end cap [9] on the side strut pin [7].

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE CORBAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

instructions.content: Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237, to the threads, thread reliefs of the bolt [11], and its shank.

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.

cautions.content: MAKE SURE THAT THE HEAD OF THE BOLT POINTS IN THE AFT DIRECTION. IF THE HEAD OF THE BOLT POINTS FORWARD, DAMAGE TO COMPONENTS AND THE AIRPLANE STRUCTURE WILL OCCUR.

instructions.content: Install the bolt [11] in the side strut pin [7].
Install the washer [12], and the nut [14] on the bolt [11].
Tighten the nut [14] to 30 in-lb (3.39 Nm) – 50 in-lb (5.65 Nm) more than the run on torque.
If it is necessary, loosen the nut [14] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the cotter pin [13].
Install the cotter pin [13] in the bolt [11].

subtasks.content: Connect the lower side strut assembly, lower [8] to the shock strut [51]:

instructions.content: Lubricate the chrome plated surfaces of the side strut pin [52] with grease, D00633.
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633.
Put the strut assembly, lower [8] in its position for attachment to the shock strut [51].
Put the side strut pin [52] through the strut assembly, lower [8] and the clevis on the shock strut [51].

notes.content: Use the thread protector, SPL-1370, for the side strut pin [52] when you do this task.

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE COR-BAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

cautions.content: DO NOT APPLY CORROSION-INHIBITING COMPOUND ON GREASE JOINTS, OR SEALED BEARINGS. THESE COMPOUNDS REMOVE GREASE AND OTHER LUBRICANTS. THEY ARE PENETRATING COMPOUNDS. THEY WILL MOVE AROUND THE SEALS AND INTO THE BEARINGS. THIS WILL CAUSE DAMAGE TO THE BEARINGS, AND JOINTS.

instructions.content:
Apply a thin layer of the corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 to these items:
1) The threads and thread reliefs of the side strut pin [52], pin [49], and the cross bolt [47].
2) The threads of the side strut nut [54], and nut [50].
3) The faces of the side strut washer [53], and washer [48].

notes.content: Do not apply corrosion preventive compound to the chrome plated surfaces.
If Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 is not available, you can use corrosion inhibiting material, G50136 as an approved alternate.

instructions.content: Remove all unwanted corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237.
Install the side strut washer [53] and the side strut nut [54] on the side strut pin [52].
Tighten the side strut nut [54] to 95 ft-lb (128.80 Nm) – 115 ft-lb (155.92 Nm) more than the run-on torque.

notes.content: Use the wrench adapter wrench adapter assembly, SPL-1361, to hold the head of the side strut pin [52] when you tighten the nut [54].

instructions.content: If it is necessary, loosen the side strut nut [54] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the cross bolt [47].
Install the cross bolt [47] with the bolt head inboard in the side strut pin [52].

notes.content: Be sure that bolt head points inboard. Otherwise, Item [49] Cotter Pin can interfere with Ground Spoiler Interlock Valve Cable and cause premature failure of the cable.

instructions.content: Install the washer [48], and the nut [50] on the cross bolt [47].
Tighten the nut [50] to 20 in-lb (2.26 Nm) – 24 in-lb (2.71 Nm) more than the run-on torque.
If it is necessary, loosen the nut [50] to the nearest castellation to align the hole for the pin [49].
Install the pin [49] in the cross bolt [47].

warnings.content: USE NITRILE GLOVES FOR SKIN PROTECTION WHEN YOU USE COR-BAN 27L, G50237. IF IT GETS ON YOUR SKIN, IMMEDIATELY REMOVE IT WITH WATER. IF THIS MATERIAL GETS IN YOUR EYES, IMMEDIATELY FLUSH YOUR EYES WITH WATER. GET MEDICAL AID. THIS MATERIAL CONTAINS FLAMMABLE AGENTS WHICH CAN CAUSE INJURIES TO PERSONNEL.

instructions.content: Check the interior of side strut pin [52] and repair the application of corrosion preventive Cor-Ban 27L Compound, G50237 as required.

subtasks.content: Remove the rope that holds the pushrod [41] in its position.
Connect the strut assembly, lower [8] to the pushrod [41]:

instructions.content: Lubricate the nut [42], washer [43], and bolt [46] with grease, D00633.
Remove all unwanted grease, D00633.
Align the hole in the pushrod [41] with the hole in the strut assembly, lower [8].
Put the bushing [45] through the strut assembly, lower [8], and the pushrod [41].
Install the washer [44] on the bolt [46].
Put the bolt [46] through the strut assembly, lower [8], and the pushrod [41].
Install the washer [43], and nut [42] on the bolt [46].
Hand tighten the nut [42] until after final adjustments to the doors are made in the subsequent steps.

subtasks.content:
If you changed the length of pushrod [41], do the step that follows:
Do this task: Main Landing Gear Shock Strut Door Adjustment, TASK 32-13-11-820-801.

notes.content: No adjustment to the doors is necessary if the pushrod was not changed.
